title: Integer constant base
body:
by **netchv**: 
Current language specification shows Go reuses rule of C language that
integer constant starting with 0 is octal. This rule doesn't have any sense
except legacy compatibility since disappearing of PDP-11 architecture, and
leads to hardly diagnosed problems.

There are languages which removed this rule (Python) and ones which never
used it in preference to explicit forms (Erlang: 8#value; Ada: #8#value,
Haskell: #ovalue).

I think this rule should be removed until the language becomes popular and
such change becomes impossible.
